data.title: Top 10 Football Players in the World Now (Updated Ranking of July 2024)
data.meta_description: Top 10 football players of all time - 1. Lionel Messi 2. Pelé (Edson Arantes do Nascimento) 3. Diego Maradona 4. Johan Cruyff 5. Beckenbauer 6. Cristiano Ronaldo 7. Zinedine Zidane 8. Alfredo Di Stéfano (Argentina/Spain) 9. George Best 10. Garrincha (Brazil)
data.text:
In this latest update, we’ve considered recent performances, records, and major milestones. With Lionel Messi’s recent move to Inter Miami and his incredible debut season in the MLS, he continues to amaze fans worldwide. Meanwhile, Cristiano Ronaldo’s consistent scoring for Al Nassr in the Saudi Pro League keeps him in the spotlight.

Additionally, current stars like Kylian Mbappe (PSG), Harry Kane (Bayern Munich), Erling Haaland (Man City), and Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) are making waves and earning their place among the greats. Their outstanding performances and remarkable statistics further enhance this list.

Top 10 Football Players in the World

Here are the best footballers with top ranking in 2024:

1. Kylian Mbappé (PSG): A World Cup-Born Megastar

Kylian Mbappé has established himself as a football megastar through his stellar performances on the grandest stage of all: the World Cup. While the Champions League and Premier League often dominate the spotlight, Mbappé’s international heroics have cemented his place among the elite. His hat-trick in the World Cup final is already legendary, showcasing his immense talent and mental strength.

Much like Neymar and Messi, Mbappé has excelled in Ligue 1, but his exceptional form for both club and country sets him apart. His consistent big-time performances on the global stage affirm his greatness and leave no doubt about his abilities.

With 802 goals and 42 trophies, Lionel Messi tops the the list of top football players of all time. Known for his exceptional dribbling, precise passing, incredible vision, and prolific goal-scoring ability, Messi has set numerous records during his illustrious career. He spent the majority of his career with FC Barcelona.

Full Name: Kylian Mbappé Lottin

Born: December 20, 1998, in Bondy, France

Position: Forward

Clubs:

AS Monaco (2015-2018)

Paris Saint-Germain (2018-present)

Achievements:

With AS Monaco:

Ligue 1 Championship: 2016-2017

With Paris Saint-Germain:

Multiple Ligue 1 Championships

Coupe de France Titles

Coupe de la Ligue Titles

With the France National Team:

FIFA World Cup Champion: 2018

FIFA World Cup Golden Boot: 2022

UEFA Nations League: 2021

Kylian Mbappé has rapidly ascended to football superstardom, showcasing his talent and mental fortitude on the global stage. His hat-trick in the World Cup final stands as a testament to his exceptional skills and big-game prowess.

2. Harry Kane (Bayern Munich)

Harry Kane has been making headlines at UEFA EURO 2024 with his crucial contributions to England’s progress in the tournament. Recently, in a dramatic last-16 match against Slovakia, Kane scored a vital goal in extra time, securing a 2-1 victory for England. This win ensured England’s place in the quarter-finals, where they will face Switzerland. Kane’s goal came just 50 seconds into the additional period, following a stunning equalizer by Jude Bellingham in the dying moments of regular time​.

Full Name: Harry Edward Kane

Born: July 28, 1993, in Walthamstow, London, England

Position: Striker

Clubs:

Tottenham Hotspur (2009-2023)

Bayern Munich (2023-present)

Achievements:

With Tottenham Hotspur:

Premier League Golden Boot: Multiple times

Numerous top-four Premier League finishes

UEFA Champions League Finalist: 2019

With Bayern Munich:

Bundesliga Champion: 2024 (anticipated)

With England National Team:

FIFA World Cup Golden Boot: 2018

UEFA European Championship Runner-up: 2020

England’s All-Time Leading Goal Score

The England captain’s finishing is exemplary, his positioning to accommodate for a lack of raw pace is second-to-none, though his unique selling point is his uncanny playmaking ability, to pick a pass from deep, to swing a cross in, to play the No.10 and No.9 roles simultaneously and effectively and he achieved all of that in a Tottenham team that, with the greatest respect, was simply not at his level and rarely has been near his standard. He is the greatest natural No.9 in world football right now.

3. Erling Haaland (Man City): The Prolific Goal Machine

Erling Haaland continues to dominate headlines with his remarkable performances for Manchester City. The Norwegian striker recently secured his second successive Premier League Golden Boot by scoring 27 goals in the 2023-2024 season, outpacing Chelsea’s Cole Palmer, who scored 22 goals. Haaland’s incredible goal-scoring prowess has been pivotal in Manchester City’s successful campaign, helping them win their fourth consecutive Premier League title​.

Haaland’s impact extends beyond the Premier League. He scored hat-tricks against Fulham and Wolves and delivered crucial goals against top teams like Liverpool, Tottenham Hotspur, Manchester United, and Chelsea. His efforts contributed significantly to City’s historic achievements, including a potential successive Premier League and FA Cup double.

Full Name: Erling Braut Haaland

Born: July 21, 2000, in Leeds, England

Position: Forward.

Clubs:

Bryne FK (2016)

Molde FK (2017-2018)

Red Bull Salzburg (2019-2020)

Borussia Dortmund (2020-2022)

Manchester City (2022-present)

Achievements:

With Red Bull Salzburg:

Austrian Bundesliga titles

Austrian Cup

With Borussia Dortmund:

DFB-Pokal title

Bundesliga Player of the Season

With Manchester City:

Premier League Golden Boot

UEFA Champions League top scorer.

Overall, Haaland has amassed an astonishing 90 goals in 96 games for Manchester City, with 38 goals scored in the current season alone. His rapid rise and record-breaking performances have solidified his reputation as one of the most prolific strikers in modern football​.

4. Mohamed Salah (Liverpool)

Mohamed Salah, the Egyptian football star and Liverpool forward, has recently signed a new long-term contract with Liverpool, putting an end to speculation about his future at Anfield. This new deal, which reportedly makes him the highest-paid player in the club’s history with weekly earnings exceeding £350,000, extends his stay and reflects his commitment to helping the team secure more trophies​​. Salah expressed his excitement and readiness to continue contributing to Liverpool’s success, emphasizing his desire to win more titles with the club.

Full Name: Mohamed Salah Hamed Mahrous Ghaly

Born: June 15, 1992, in Nagrig, Egypt

Position: Forward/Winger

Clubs:

El Mokawloon (2010-2012)

Basel (2012-2014)

Chelsea (2014-2016)

Fiorentina (loan, 2015)

Roma (2015-2017)

Liverpool (2017-present)

Achievements:

With Liverpool:

Premier League Champion: 2019-2020

UEFA Champions League Winner: 2018-2019

FIFA Club World Cup Winner: 2019

Numerous individual awards, including Premier League Golden Boot

With Egypt National Team:

Africa Cup of Nations Runner-up: 2017

BBC African Footballer of the Year: 2017, 2018

For a player with a relatively simple playing style, he remains an enigma to halt. We say ‘simple’ in the least derogatory way possible. Salah is a touchline-hugging, direct winger with the ability to drive inside as he approaches the box. It should be easy to see it coming, but nobody has found a way to stop him.

If he racks up another couple of 20+ goal seasons, he will hit the 200 Premier League goals mark, an unbelievable achievement for any player, let alone a winger playing out wide.

5. Jude Bellingham (Real Madrid): Rising Star of English Football

Jude Bellingham has recently been in the spotlight due to his performances and a controversial incident during Euro 2024. In England’s last-16 victory over Slovakia, Bellingham scored a dramatic bicycle kick to level the match in stoppage time, taking it into extra time, where England eventually won. However, following his goal, Bellingham made a gesture that led to an investigation by UEFA. The gesture, which he insisted was an “inside joke” among friends, resulted in a suspended one-match ban and a fine of €30,000 (£25,406). Despite the controversy, Bellingham has been cleared to play in England’s quarter-final match against Switzerland​.

Full Name: Jude Victor William Bellingham

Born: June 29, 2003, in Stourbridge, England

Position: Midfielder

Clubs:

Birmingham City (2010-2020)

Borussia Dortmund (2020-2023)

Real Madrid (2023-present)

Achievements:

With Borussia Dortmund:

DFB-Pokal Winner: 2021

Numerous Bundesliga accolades

With Real Madrid:

La Liga accolades

With England National Team:

UEFA European Championship Runner-up: 2021

FIFA World Cup appearances: 2022

Bellingham’s rapid rise to prominence has been marked by his exceptional performances and maturity beyond his years, making him a key player for both club and country

6. Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City)

Kevin De Bruyne, the star midfielder for Manchester City and the Belgian national team, is currently facing a challenging period due to a significant injury. De Bruyne sustained a hamstring injury during Manchester City’s Premier League opener against Burnley in August 2023, which is expected to sideline him for several months. This injury has put a damper on his season, potentially causing him to miss up to 26 matches, including critical Champions League fixtures and the FIFA Club World Cup​.

In addition to his injury woes, De Bruyne has been at the center of transfer rumors. Reports suggest he has a verbal agreement to join Al-Ittihad, a Saudi Pro League club, in the upcoming transfer window. While Manchester City has been considering a new contract for their playmaker, his injury history and the lucrative offer from the Saudi club might influence his decision

Full Name: Kevin De Bruyne

Born: June 28, 1991, in Drongen, Belgium

Position: Midfielder.

Clubs:

KRC Genk (2008-2012)

Chelsea FC (2012-2014)

VfL Wolfsburg (2014-2015)

Manchester City (2015-present)

Achievements:

With Manchester City:

Multiple Premier League titles

FA Cup titles

EFL Cup titles

UEFA Champions League winner

With Belgium National Team:

FIFA World Cup Third Place: 2018

UEFA European Championship top performances.

Despite these setbacks, De Bruyne continues to shine on the international stage. He recently scored in Belgium’s 2-0 victory over Romania in the Euro 2024 group stage, demonstrating his enduring impact and leadership as the team captain​.

7. Lionel Messi (Inter Miami)

Lionel Messi continues to make headlines with his stellar performances and significant milestones in 2024. Playing for Inter Miami, Messi has been a key player in the Major League Soccer (MLS) season, scoring 12 goals and providing 13 assists in just 12 games, showcasing his extraordinary talent and impact on the field. His remarkable form has earned him a place in the 2024 MLS All-Star team, where he will be joined by teammates Luis Suarez, Jordi Alba, and Sergio Busquets for the match against Mexico’s Liga MX All-Stars on July 24 in Columbus, Ohio.

In addition to his club success, Messi continues to play a crucial role for the Argentina national team. He is currently competing in the 2024 Copa America, where Argentina is striving to defend their title. Despite some recent injury concerns, Messi remains a vital part of Lionel Scaloni’s plans and has been pivotal in Argentina’s progress in the tournament​.

Full Name: Lionel Andrés Messi

Born: June 24, 1987, in Rosario, Santa Fe, Argentina

Position: Forward/Attacking Midfielder

Clubs:

FC Barcelona (2000-2021):

Numerous La Liga championships

Multiple UEFA Champions League titles

Numerous Copa del Rey titles

Multiple FIFA Club World Cup titles

Numerous Ballon d’Or awards

Inter Miami (2023-present):

Continuing to showcase his incredible talent in Major League Soccer (MLS)

Achievements:

With Argentina National Team:

Copa America champion: 2021

Olympic Gold Medal: 2008

FIFA World Cup Golden Ball (best player): 2014, 2022.

Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi are no longer the undisputed top two in world football. There are plenty of superstars across the planet, with the bulk of the most talented players plying their trade in Europe, but when it comes to comparing the top performers, the playing field is significantly more level.

8. Lautaro Martinez (Inter Milan)

Lautaro Martínez has been making significant contributions to Argentina’s success in the Copa America 2024. The 26-year-old Inter Milan captain has been in stellar form, scoring four goals in the group stage matches, including a decisive brace in a 2-0 victory over Peru. His performance has been instrumental in helping Argentina finish the group stage with a perfect record, winning all three matches against Peru, Chile, and Canada​.

Full Name: Lautaro Javier Martínez

Born: August 22, 1997, in Bahía Blanca, Argentina

Position: Forward

Clubs:

Racing Club (2015-2018):

Showcased his potential as a prolific striker in the Argentine Primera División.

Inter Milan (2018-present):

Key player in winning the Serie A title (2020-2021).

Achievements:

With Inter Milan:

Serie A Champion: 2020-2021.

Coppa Italia winner: 2021-2022.

Supercoppa Italiana winner: 2021.

With Argentina National Team:

Copa America Champion: 2021.

FIFA World Cup: Quarter-finalist (2022).

In addition to his Copa America heroics, Martínez has reaffirmed his commitment to Inter Milan by reportedly agreeing to a new contract, which underscores his importance to the club​​. As the tournament progresses, all eyes will be on Martínez to see if he can continue his excellent form and lead Argentina to further glory

9. Rodri (Man City)

Rodri, the influential Spanish midfielder, has been making headlines both for his club, Manchester City, and his national team. Recently, he played a crucial role in Spain’s 4-1 victory over Georgia in the Euro 2024, scoring a pivotal goal that helped secure their place in the quarter-finals against Germany​​. His performance at the Euros has been widely praised, further cementing his reputation as one of the best midfielders in the world​.

On the club front, Manchester City is reportedly preparing a new lucrative contract for Rodri to ensure his long-term future at the Etihad Stadium. The new deal, which will significantly increase his current wages of £220,000 per week, is a testament to his indispensable role in Pep Guardiola’s squad​. This move comes as no surprise, given Rodri’s consistent top-level performances and his ability to control the midfield, making him a vital part of City’s recent successes.

Full Name: Rodrigo Hernández Cascante (Rodri)

Born: June 22, 1996, in Madrid, Spain

Position: Defensive Midfielder

Clubs:

Villarreal CF (2015-2018)

Atlético Madrid (2018-2019)

Manchester City (2019-present)

Achievements:

With Manchester City:

Premier League championships

UEFA Champions League title

FA Cup titles

EFL Cup titles

With Spain National Team:

UEFA Nations League champion: 2023

Euro Under-21 champion: 2019

10. Vinicius Jr (Real Madrid)

Vinícius Júnior, commonly known as Vinícius Jr., is a Brazilian footballer who plays as a winger for Real Madrid and the Brazil national team. Born on July 12, 2000, in São Gonçalo, Brazil, Vinícius Jr. has quickly risen to fame for his exceptional speed, dribbling skills, and goal-scoring prowess. He joined Real Madrid from Flamengo in 2018 and has since established himself as a crucial player for the Spanish giants.

Recently, Vinícius Jr. has been making headlines for his standout performances in both La Liga and the UEFA Champions League. He has been instrumental in Real Madrid’s attacking strategies, often turning the tide of matches with his agility and creativity on the field. His performances have not only earned him praise from fans and critics but also secured his place as one of the top young talents in world football.

Full Name: Vinícius José Paixão de Oliveira Júnior

Born: July 12, 2000, in São Gonçalo, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

Position: Winger/Forward

Clubs:

Flamengo (2017-2018)

Real Madrid (2018-present)

Achievements:

With Flamengo:

Campeonato Carioca: 2017

With Real Madrid:

La Liga titles: Multiple

UEFA Champions League: 2022

FIFA Club World Cup: Multiple

Individual Honors:

FIFA FIFPro World11: 2023

With Brazil National Team:

Copa América: 2021 (Runner-up)

Olympic Gold Medal: 2020

In addition to his on-field achievements, Vinícius Jr. has been vocal about social issues, particularly racism. He has faced racial abuse during matches and has used his platform to advocate against such discrimination, bringing much-needed attention to the issue within the football community. His efforts have been widely supported, highlighting the importance of addressing racism in sports.

Who is the Best Football Player in the World Now (In 2024)

Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo are considered the two greatest footballers of their generation. Messi, often called the Greatest of All Time (GOAT), crowned his amazing career by winning the World Cup in 2022. He also won seven Ballon d’Or awards, ten La Liga titles with Barcelona, and multiple Champions League trophies. Messi’s skill, vision, and goal-scoring made him a top player in football history

With Messi and Ronaldo stepping down, the title of the world’s best footballer is up for grabs. Kylian Mbappe, a top French forward, is seen as the best football player in the world in 2024. His speed, finishing, and technical skills have been outstanding for Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) and the French national team.

Mbappe is expected to join Real Madrid this summer, a move that is highly anticipated. Real Madrid, known for signing top players, believes Mbappe will fit perfectly with their attacking stars, Vinicius Jr. and Jude Bellingham. This move could make Real Madrid even stronger in La Liga and the Champions League.

Mbappe’s transfer is set to start a new era in football. As Messi and Ronaldo’s time ends, new talents like Mbappe will aim to become the top players, competing for titles and awards.

Also Check –

The 10 Best Goalkeepers in the World (Right Now)

Top 10 Fastest Runners in the World 2024

Top 10 Most Handsome Men in the World 2024

Football has seen some incredible talents over the years, and our updated July 2024 ranking brings you the top 10 football players of all time. From legendary goal-scorers to unbeatable defenders, these athletes have left a lasting mark on the beautiful game. This list includes iconic names like Mbappe, Lionel Messi, Jude Bellingham and Harry Kane (Bayern Munich), each celebrated for their unique skills and extraordinary careers.

Conclusion

As we conclude our updated ranking for July 2024, the football world witnesses a significant transition. Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo, regarded as the greatest footballers of their generation, are stepping down after illustrious careers.

With their era ending, Kylian Mbappé emerges as the best football player in the world. His exceptional speed, finishing, and technical prowess have made him a standout for PSG and the French national team. Mbappé’s anticipated move to Real Madrid is set to start a new era, positioning him alongside rising stars like Vinícius Jr. and Jude Bellingham. This transition marks the beginning of a new chapter in football, with fresh talents aiming to dominate the sport and achieve greatness.

Who is currently considered the best football player in the world?

As of July 2024, Kylian Mbappe is widely regarded as the best football player in the world. His performances for Paris Saint-Germain and the French national team have been outstanding, showcasing his incredible speed, skill, and goal-scoring ability.

Who is the No 1 richest footballer in the world?

Faiq Bolkiah holds the title of the world’s wealthiest football player, boasting a staggering net worth of $20 billion, primarily stemming from his family’s substantial inheritance. He is a scion of Brunei’s royal lineage, being the son of the Brunei Prince.

Who are the top contenders for the Ballon d’Or in 2024?

The top contenders for the Ballon d’Or in 2024 include Kylian Mbappe, Erling Haaland, and Lionel Messi. Their exceptional performances over the past year have put them in the spotlight for this prestigious award.

Who is better, Ronaldo or Messi?

Argentina star Messi has scored 108 goals in 184 international appearances – both all-time records for his nation. With 130 goals in 209 games for Portugal, Ronaldo holds both the all-time men’s records for international appearances and goals.

Which young players are emerging as the next football superstars?

Emerging young superstars include Jude Bellingham, Vinicius Jr., and Pedri. These players have shown remarkable talent and consistency, making them ones to watch in the future.

Is Erling Haaland considered one of the best players in the world?

Erling Haaland is considered one of the best players in the world. His goal-scoring prowess for Manchester City and his impressive physical attributes have made him a standout player in recent seasons.
